column4: so what's the hoary-updates apt repos that are default disabled?
on april 7th, after hoary is released, they will ne no longer disabled
consider them a placeholder at present
how do they differ from the security updates repos?
"updates" are changes to the stable release, which only happens for hoary on 6 april
ok, I'll just ignore it untill then. thanks
i'm about to speak of 802.11g, not 802.11b, so bear that in mind
the linksys card, of the *same* model number etc, had at least four different revisions, all of which used a *different* chipset (and thus required a different driver) as ridiculous as that sounds
quite the pain determining this of course, when someone tells you that you need driver "foo" for that model, etc.   is it possible that the same is true of yours?
i've been using the orinoco driver bundled with the kernel for a long time, FC 1-3, ubuntu warty, ...
oh, the same physical card?  then you know it's that driver, ignore what i said
heh, I had the SSID messed up, it works now
heh, glad it's working, frustrating when it turns out to be completely outside where you were looking :)
yes, and they'll want the js extention, i'm sure
does standalone acroread call home, or just the plugin?
the spyware requires javascript, hence requires the plugin
